alert.note: Alert for Adams; Hocking; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS, HOCKING, PIKE, SCIOTO AND SOUTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 123 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles east of Kingston to near Rome, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Portsmouth, Logan, Wheelersburg, Waverly, Nelsonville, New Boston, Piketon, Vanceburg, South Webster, Rosemount, Clarktown, Rome, Lucasville, Franklin Furnace, Hocking Hills State Park, Sciotodale, Starr, Blue Creek, Londonderry and Laurelville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
